title: Workshop on Designing Social Issue-Based Science Education Using Generative AI

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Course where participants experience AI-integrated instructional design through collaborative action research and explore educational potential of Socially Significant Issues (SSI) and generative AI.

learning_goals: Over 80% of socially-issue-based science educational materials can be autonomously designed using generative AI.

Learners use AI-supported discussion platforms (e.g., Perplexity, ChatGPT) to analyze perspectives of three or more stakeholders (students, teachers, parents) in educational settings, participate in discussions (two or more times), and demonstrate critical thinking meeting at least two of three evaluation criteria (clarity, logic, creativity) in a 500+ word analysis report.
Practical challenges encountered during AI-integrated lesson design are resolved by applying collaborative action research methodologies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
